content: A Word of Comfort to Baruch
The word that the prophet Jeremiah spoke to Baruch son of Neriah, when he wrote these words in a scroll at the dictation of Jeremiah, in the fourth year of King Jehoiakim son of Josiah of Judah:
Thus says the , the God of Israel, to you, O Baruch:
You said, “Woe is me! The  has added sorrow to my pain; I am weary with my groaning, and I find no rest.”
Thus you shall say to him, “Thus says the : I am going to break down what I have built, and pluck up what I have planted—that is, the whole land.

And you, do you seek great things for yourself? Do not seek them; for I am going to bring disaster upon all flesh, says the ; but I will give you your life as a prize of war in every place to which you may go.”
